credit_line: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane
title: Design for the Decoration of the Saloon, the Royal Pavillion, Brighton
medium: Brush and watercolor, graphite on paper
description:
Rendering of the Salon as it looked in 1802, with the hand-painted Chinese wallpaper and painted strip still in place as well as the painted fretwork on the ceiling, but without draperies at the windows.   A design for a new chandelier in the Chinese style is sketched in with pencil.

Original album associated with this collection still exists.  See 1948-40-1 accessory
name: Drawing
